page.title: 17Housing
page.content: There is a group of about twenty houses which forms the village of Skenfrith.Apart from this the remainder of the housing is very scattered-mainly farmhouses and cottages. There has not been much building in the area for over thirty years when some council houses were built in the village.One reason for this is that this is an area of natural beauty and planning has been very strict about new housing.Another reason is that there is no main sewer.The only type of building which has been allowed is the odd infilling in the village and accomodation for farm workers. Some of the houses date from about 1600.Most of the houses are built of stone.
